message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with efficient probabilistic group testing schemes, which involve information theory and cryptography (traitor tracing). Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves algorithms and data structures for group testing, which falls under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, the paper mentions threshold group testing and noisy group testing, which are related to combinatorial optimization and discrete mathematics, respectively, and thus cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves probabilistic analysis and statistical inference, which are related to machine learning and statistics, respectively, and thus cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a possible sub-category as well.
